frameDefinitions: This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.
A Protagonist is described as being exposed to a potentially dangerous situation that may end in a Bad_outcome for him- or herself.

A Manner describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways:  First, it can refer to how a Comparison_event transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. 'the way you talk').
Due to internal forces/properties, an Entity is inclined towards a particular Behavior, which may be to perform an action or to maintain a state.
A Hunter tries to gain Food by way of outsmarting or tracking a living.
An Agent performs some Action which is considered imprudent.
frameExamples: It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
He completed the task in a fervent <t>manner</t>.
In the Congo, he hunted big game for the first time.
listRoleDefinitions: The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The person who is at risk of some <fen>Bad_outcome</fen>
A situation that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> would like to avoid.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protagonist</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The <fen>Action</fen> that creates the risk.
The time when the risk pertains.
The place where there is risk.

The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
The description of the <fen>Comparison_event</fen> or <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
A description of the <fen>Manner</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described.
TheFrame Element <fen>Entity</fen> identifies the person or thing that has a tendency towards some Behaviour.
The role <fen>Behavior</fen> marks expressions that indicate which state or action the <fen>Entity</fen> tends towards.
The <fen>Hunter</fen> is the agent hoping to obtain <fen>Food</fen>.
<fen>Food</fen> is the sought-out item by the <fen>Hunter</fen>.
This is the entity to which the <fen>Hunter</fen> pays attention. It is referred to as <fen>Ground</fen> because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Food</fen>.
When the <fen>Time</fen> seeking action occurs.
The greater geographic location where the <fen>Hunter</fen> attempts to obtain <fen>Food</fen>.
The individual that performs the <fen>Action</fen>, resulting in danger to themself.
This role denotes the <fen>Action</fen> taken by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> dares to perform the <fen>Action</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> risks doing the <fen>Action</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.
There was no risk <fex>of his returning</fex>.
The risk <fex>to his reputation</fex> was significant.
<fex>Implementing this program</fex> runs the risk of offending our core constituents.
<fex>Even after the end of Apartheit</fex> we still run the risk of letting racism continue forever.
There is always some danger to rich men <fex>in a bar like this</fex>.
<fex>Lubomir</fex> was not inclined to believe me
Martha has a tendency <fex>to overdo the housekeeping</fex>.
I do n't think <fex>you</fex> should hazard the ascent in the dark , that 's all .
<fex>At dawn</fex>, the Captain chanced opening the hatch.
<fex>Back in his room</fex>, he risked peeking inside.
